posts.title: Holiday (1938)
posts.excerpt: Quote:Two years before stars Katharine Hepburn and Cary Grant and director George Cukor would collaborate on The Philadelphia Story, they brought their timeless talents to this delectable slice of 1930s romantic-comedy perfection, the second film adaptation of a hit 1928 play by Philip Barry. Grant is at his charismatic best as the acrobatically inclined free …

posts._title: Arturas Barysas – Sakyti tik tiesa AKA To Tell Only The Truth (1978)
posts.title: Sakyti tik tiesa
posts.excerpt: Arturas Barysas “Baras” (May 10, 1954 – January 28, 2005) was a Lithuanian “counter-culture” actor, singer, bibliophile, record collector, photographer, and filmmaker, known as the father of modern Lithuanian avant-garde. His works were declared “apolitical and immoral” by the cultural nomenklatura of the Soviet Union.

posts.title: Phantasm II
posts.excerpt: Quote:The “Tall Man” and his strange little Killer Sphere return for a second round in this sequel to the 1979 cult favorite. Mike Pearson (James LeGros) is still plagued by memories of the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), an evil mortician who has risen from the grave and bleeds embalming fluid — and tried to kill …

posts._title: Melisa Liebenthal – Aqui y Alla AKA Here and There (2020)
posts.title: Aqui y Alla
posts.excerpt: Here and There is an essay film that studies what being at home means. The filmmaker uses photographs, maps and Google Earth to connect places around the globe; not just from her own past, but also from the complex migratory history of her family that stretches back to Hitler-era Germany and Mao’s China. Reality and …

posts.title: Ælektra
posts.excerpt: A fashion film written & directed by Asia Argento for Antonio Grimaldi Couture Collection A/W 2020/21.

posts._title: Anton Bialas – À l’entrée de la nuit AKA At The Entrance Of The Night (2020)
posts.title: À l’entrée de la nuit
posts.excerpt: SynopsisTwo Senegalese men walk through a forest in Morocco at night. As they try to find a passageway to the north, they talk about a strange dream. Two officers from the Spanish Civil Guard patrol the Spanish coast in an SUV. The car’s headlights probe the darkness in search of illegal immigrants. In Paris, a …

posts._title: Raoul Ruiz & Valeria Sarmiento – El Tango del Viudo y Su Espejo Deformante AKA The Tango of the Widower and Its Distorting Mirror (2020)
posts.title: El Tango del Viudo y Su Espejo Deformante
posts.excerpt: DescriptionThe story of a man whose wife has committed suicide and appears to him as a ghost, following him everywhere and changing his personality. Unfinished in 1967 and restored for a 2020 premiere.
posts.titleEnglish: The Tango of the Widower and Its Distorting Mirror

posts._title: Sokrates Kapsaskis & Doris Wishman – O Zestos minas Avgoustos AKA The Hot Month of August (1966)
posts.title: O Zestos minas Avgoustos
posts.excerpt: A chance encounter with an international playboy and a clandestine affair with a cryptic married woman entangle an unsuspecting young man in a well-planned conspiracy. Has anyone emerged unscathed from the unbreakable shackles of passion? (IMDB)

posts.title: Phantasm
posts.excerpt: Quote:Mike, a young teenage boy who has just lost his parents, is afraid to lose his brother. This fear causes him to follow his brother to a funeral, where Mike witnesses the Tall Man lift a coffin on his own. Mike decides to investigate and discovers a horrible world where the Tall Man, along with …
